key.name: button-layout
key.summary: Arrangement of buttons on the titlebar
key.description: Arrangement of buttons on the titlebar. The value should be a string, such as "menu:minimize,maximize,spacer,close"; the colon separates the left corner of the window from the right corner, and the button names are comma-separated. Duplicate buttons are not allowed. Unknown button names are silently ignored so that buttons can be added in future metacity versions without breaking older versions. A special spacer tag can be used to insert some space between two adjacent buttons.

key.name: button-style
key.summary: Button layout style
key.description: Which layout to use for window buttons

key.name: desktop-type-override
key.summary: Desktop Type Override
key.description: This setting will enable the force enable the use of a specific application responsible for presenting a desktop-type window. By default, Budgie will present settings via Budgie Desktop Settings for the first application it finds, in the following order: budgie-desktop-view, desktopfolder, and nemo. This option, when set to none, will perform no overriding. When setting it to a specific type, we will present the settings for that application assuming it exists. It will show no settings if the app cannot be found in PATH. This option does not guarantee that the application is running or will run at start-up. That is the responsible of the user, vendor, or software.
